trap.title: String traversal
trap.intro: You can iterate on characters of a string. What will be printed?
trap.discussion:
Strings are just slices of bytes, and are not required to be UTF-8 encoded. But the range loop assumes UTF-8 encoding. The value is the rune (like a character), and the index is the number of the byte (not the number of the rune). Thus, when the multi-byte character Ã© is encountered, the index 4 is skipped.
Reference:
  • http://blog.golang.org/strings
